summary: The 'FinOps Specialist' course is designed to prepare finance professionals for careers in cloud financial operations. The course covers a wide range of topics, including an introduction to AWS Cloud and its global infrastructure, basic AWS Cloud architectural principles, the AWS Cloud value proposition, and key AWS services and their use cases. Participants will learn about security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform, cloud pricing and billing, finance tools and options, and AWS cost explorer. The course also includes practical exercises such as use cases, brainstorming sessions, and a final exam based on AWS Cost Explorer. Additional topics include cost control strategies (tags, alerts, budgeting), third-party FinOps tools, cloud cost monitoring, Kubernetes (K8S) from a FinOps perspective, and tips for success and best practices. The course is hybrid, offering the flexibility to attend classes either on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan or via Zoom.

COURSE NAME: FinOps Specialist

COURSE OVERVIEW: This course is designed to prepare finance professionals for careers in cloud environments. It focuses on the principles and practices of FinOps, cloud financial management, and AWS Cloud services. Participants will gain the skills needed to manage cloud costs effectively and understand the financial aspects of cloud computing.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 31.01.2025.
- Duration: 8 sessions.
- Academic Hours: 40 hours.
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held at Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on participant preference.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Define what the AWS Cloud is and the basic global infrastructure.
- Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Explain the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Identify key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Discuss basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describe the basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.
- Cloud Concept and overall review.
- Main Cloud Services.
- FinOps – What is it and why is it needed?
- Cloud pricing and billing.
- Finance tools and options, including commitments and agreements.
- AWS Cost Explorer introduction.
- Use case and brainstorming sessions.
- Cost Control – Tags, Alerts, Budgeting, etc.
- Kubernetes (K8S) – Introduction, high-level technical review, and FinOps perspective.
- FinOps third-party tools and products.
- Cloud cost monitoring.
- Tips for success and best practices.
- Final Exam/Exercise based on AWS Cost Explorer.

CERTIFICATIONS: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner - Foundational.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and register, contact: 
  - Phone: 052-5886002.
  - Email: esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: 
- Offered by Bar-Ilan University, School of High-Tech and Cyber.
- Dedicated to specialized programs for career development in high-tech and cyber fields.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: 
- The course is part of Bar-Ilan University's initiative to prepare finance professionals for the next stage in their careers in cloud environments.
- The program emphasizes practical skills and real-world applications to ensure participants are well-equipped for industry challenges.
